keyMoments.title: Queen Otohime's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Queen Otohime is introduced as the compassionate ruler of Ryugu Kingdom who advocates for peaceful coexistence between fish-men and humans.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes her as a central figure in Fish-Man Island's history and her philosophy of peace.
keyMoments.quote: Distance is the closure of a person's heart. Only through direct communication can we bridge the divide.

keyMoments.title: Observation Haki Demonstration
keyMoments.description: Otohime dodges bullets fired by Papaneel with her eyes closed, revealing her innate Observation Haki ability.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Otohime was born with Observation Haki, showcasing her exceptional spiritual power.

keyMoments.title: Physical Fragility Revealed
keyMoments.description: After slapping Papaneel, Otohime's hand suffers a complex fracture, revealing her extremely fragile physical body despite her spiritual strength.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights the contrast between her spiritual power and physical weakness, emphasizing her courage.

keyMoments.title: Petition Campaign Speech
keyMoments.description: Otohime delivers a passionate speech at Gyoncorde Plaza, encouraging citizens to sign her petition for migration to the surface.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes her central mission and the resistance she faces from her own people.
keyMoments.quote: We shouldn't judge humans based on the actions of a few. We must try to befriend them and live together on the surface.

abilities.description: Otohime was born with Observation Haki, allowing her to sense emotions and predict movements, enabling her to dodge bullets with her eyes closed.

relationships.description: Otohime is the wife of King Neptune and Queen of Ryugu Kingdom.
Otohime respects Fisher Tiger's heroism and is moved to tears by the horrors he witnessed at Mary Geoise.

evolutionMoments.description: Otohime breaks into tears upon hearing Tiger's account of what he saw at Mary Geoise.

reveals.information: Extremely fragile body that breaks easily
Campaigning for peaceful coexistence with humans and migration to surface

name.japanese: フィッシャー・タイガー

keyMoments.title: Fisher Tiger's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Fisher Tiger arrives at Ryugu Palace as a legendary adventurer to reveal his momentous actions to King Neptune.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the most important figures in Fish-Man Island history.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Mary Geoise Slave Liberation
keyMoments.description: Tiger reveals to Neptune that he freed slaves from Mary Geoise, responding 'humans' when asked what he saw there.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Tiger's legendary status and the trauma that drives him.

keyMoments.title: The Ransacking of Mary Geoise
keyMoments.description: Flashback reveals Tiger climbed the Red Line and freed all slaves from Mary Geoise 15 years ago, including fish-men, humans, and others.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most significant acts of rebellion against the World Government.

keyMoments.title: Formation of the Sun Pirates
keyMoments.description: Fisher Tiger establishes the Sun Pirates and creates the sun symbol to cover slave brands.
keyMoments.significance: Creates one of the most important pirate crews in One Piece history.

bounties.reason: Attacking Mary Geoise and freeing slaves

abilities.description: As a sea bream fish-man, Tiger possesses exceptional physical strength and martial arts prowess.

relationships.description: Tiger reports his actions to King Neptune, showing respect for the Ryugu Kingdom's ruler.
Tiger's revelation of the horrors at Mary Geoise moves Otohime to tears, establishing mutual understanding.
Tiger becomes Jinbe's captain when Jinbe joins the Sun Pirates.

evolutionMoments.description: Jinbe is inspired by Tiger's actions and joins the Sun Pirates.

relationships.description: Tiger becomes Arlong's captain when Arlong joins the Sun Pirates.

reveals.information: Freed slaves from Mary Geoise 15 years ago
Was formerly enslaved at Mary Geoise
Despite hating humans, freed slaves of all races without discrimination
Founded the Sun Pirates and created the sun symbol to cover slave brands

keyMoments.title: Papaneel's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Papaneel appears as a desperate robber trying to steal money to feed his ten children, confronting Queen Otohime.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the poverty affecting some Fish-Man Island citizens.

keyMoments.title: Shoots at Otohime
keyMoments.description: Papaneel shoots at Queen Otohime when she tries to stop him, but she dodges using Observation Haki.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the demonstration of Otohime's Haki abilities.

relationships.description: After attempting to rob and shoot Otohime, Papaneel is moved by her compassion and swears to change his ways.

evolutionMoments.description: Otohime shows compassion for Papaneel's situation, leading him to reform.

reveals.information: Has ten children and resorted to robbery to feed them

keyMoments.title: Aladine's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Aladine appears as a former slave who joins the Sun Pirates after being freed.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a key Sun Pirates member who represents freed slaves.

abilities.description: Aladine serves as the doctor of the Sun Pirates.

relationships.description: Aladine serves under Fisher Tiger in the Sun Pirates.

reveals.information: Was formerly enslaved before being freed
Serves as doctor for the Sun Pirates

keyMoments.title: Jinbe Joins the Sun Pirates
keyMoments.description: Inspired by Fisher Tiger's heroic actions, Jinbe leaves the Neptune Army to join the Sun Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: A pivotal moment in Jinbe's history, setting him on the path to becoming a Warlord and later a Straw Hat.

relationships.description: Jinbe joins the Sun Pirates under Fisher Tiger's leadership.

evolutionMoments.description: Jinbe leaves the Neptune Army to join Tiger's crew.

reveals.information: Was initially skeptical of Otohime's peaceful approach
Left the Neptune Army to join the Sun Pirates

keyMoments.title: Arlong Joins the Sun Pirates
keyMoments.description: Arlong and his gang join Fisher Tiger's Sun Pirates, bringing together fish-men from the Fish-Man District.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Arlong's connection to the Sun Pirates and provides context for his later actions in East Blue.

relationships.description: Arlong serves under Fisher Tiger in the Sun Pirates.
Arlong and Jinbe grew up together in the Fish-Man District.

reveals.information: Grew up with Jinbe in the Fish-Man District
Joined the Sun Pirates under Fisher Tiger
